Review Text: Our stay at Sofitel Nusa Dua was absolutely exceptional from start to finish. The resort exudes pure luxury, with an elegant atmosphere that immediately makes you feel relaxed and pampered. Every corner of the property is immaculate ‚Äî from the lush tropical gardens to the sparkling pools and beautifully designed rooms. The staff service was outstanding, and we‚Äôd love to give special thanks to Pande, our housekeeper, who kept our room spotless every single day and always greeted us with a warm smile. His attention to detail and friendliness made our stay even more comfortable. We also want to highlight Andika from the restaurant team, who went above and beyond to make sure our breakfasts and meals met all our expectations. The food was consistently delicious, and Andika‚Äôs attentive service made every dining experience a pleasure. The resort‚Äôs location right by the beach is another major plus ‚Äî it‚Äôs peaceful, clean, and perfect for morning walks or sunset views. There are plenty of dining options, from international buffets to authentic local cuisine, so there‚Äôs something for everyone to enjoy without ever needing to leave the resort. Overall, Sofitel Nusa Dua delivers everything you could hope for in a five-star getaway ‚Äî luxury, comfort, and world-class service. We left feeling refreshed and already planning our next visit. Highly recommended! üå¥‚ú®

We stayed at Sofitel Nusa Dua for several days in November and had a wonderful experience from start to finish. The welcome was exceptional. As Platinum members, we were received at Club Mill√©sime, where we could check in in a calm and comfortable setting while enjoying a drink. The hotel truly offers excellent benefits for Accor members. We received a complimentary room upgrade to a room with a private pool and a beautiful terrace, which we thoroughly enjoyed. There were absolutely no issues with insects or pests. The room was spacious and extremely clean, and we were welcomed with delicious snacks upon arrival. Housekeeping was spotless every single day. Club Mill√©sime is the perfect place to fully unwind. Snacks are available throughout the day, and what truly impressed us was that during check-in we were asked about dietary restrictions. These were genuinely taken into account: the staff immediately knew our dietary needs upon entering the club without us having to remind them, and at times they even prepared custom-made snacks when nothing else was suitable. The breakfast menu in the club itself felt a bit limited, which is why we chose to have breakfast in the main restaurant instead. Dining at Kwee Zeen Restaurant was fantastic, with a wide variety of dishes ranging from Western to Indonesian and Indian cuisine. The restaurant was also very clean. The swimming pools were well maintained and clean, with staff available to offer towels. However, we did feel that there could have been more sun loungers available, especially in the afternoon when it became quite challenging to find a spot. The hotel is located directly on the beach, where sunbeds and towels are also provided. There were plenty of complimentary daily activities, such as sports, as well as paid activities like banana leaf folding and fruit carving. The paid activities were incredibly fun, and since it was just the two of us, we received full personal attention from the staff (sorry guys, we forgot your names!). Lastly, a very special shoutout to the staff who made my birthday truly unforgettable. From morning until dinner, I was completely spoiled. In the morning, during our banana leaf folding activity, the staff suddenly appeared singing with a cake and balloons. In the evening, Yuli and Febri made the night unforgettable by arriving singing with a birthday cake during dinner. It is worth noting that there is not much to do in the immediate surroundings of the hotel. This is truly a destination to relax and unwind. Do not expect to walk outside and find many restaurants or shops nearby. That said, ordering food and other items via Grab is very easy and convenient. The next time we are in Bali, we will definitely be staying with you again.

Can't fault this resort! All the staff are super friendly and helpful, they all stop and say hello when you walk past! Plenty of good food options, great room service, tailor to any requests you have. Organised taxis when required to go anywhere. Big shout-out to Sri who served us at breakfast most mornings! We always had a complicated a-la-carte order, but she made it happen every day, and remembered our order for the next day! She was super friendly and was so professional, you can tell she loves what she does. 10/10 for Sri üëè Also the massage on the beach is also a great addition!

Fantastic resort. Grand set up. The whole plays breathes luxury. Multiples pools, a number of eateries. Excellent quality food. Beautiful spot on the beach. Very large light well equipped rooms. Lovely view of looking the compound and the sea. Great fitness, nicely air conditioned, lot of equipment. The breakfast is simply overwhelming., Traditional, Asian, Indian cuisine all available. One of the highlights is there fresh juice & veggie bar where your choice of drink is freshly pressed. This resort offers all that you expect from a very luxurious place, and more. Their greatest acid however, is their staff. All of them are really geared towards excellent service to the clients. Welcoming, courteous, communicative. they are all excellent representatives of this resort, they‚Äôre all very good hosts in their own right. Shining example Mira, Mia and Michelle who amongst other things, attend to all your breakfast / lunch / dinner needs with a big big smile.It is simply great to see their lovely smile every morning and enjoy their great service to make your day as good as possible. They really anticipate on your needs and wishes. As if they read your mind. Nusa Dua Is in fact whole string of hotels and resorts. This, no doubt has to be one of the absolute better ones. Highly recommended.

The staff at Bali Sofitel have been consistent in high quality service. I love that all staff greet and welcome us when we walk past any staff member. I can also see the friendly service thy go above and beyond to accommodate our needs. What I found extra special as a consumer that has come back three years in a row was the hospitality. From the entrance we are greeted with a bracelet that wishes all staff prosperity. All these small details makes the difference. This time around on our third year we came to a medical conference to Sofitel. The food was to be commended. Morning tea was provided at 930am and had the most variety of food and drinks. Conference ending there was still never ending top up on food and beverages when the conference ended.I found that quite special, having been to other conferences around other hotels. Sofitel Bali hotel was by far the best catering for food. During the 6 days of stay we had moved rooms three and from the management I put my hat down to them. I commend them for exceptional service in service delivery. I had the honour of meeting the Director of rooms during the meet and greet for Accor members that happens weekly. Amy is to be mentioned as she has an amazing team under her. Her commitment and dedication is seen through her team.

We had an amazing stay, and a huge part of that was thanks to our servers, Sri and Angga. They were incredibly accommodating, attentive, and always made sure we had everything we needed throughout our stay. Their warmth and professionalism truly made the experience feel special. The room itself was also impressive ‚Äî spacious at 88 sqm, beautifully designed, and very comfortable. We especially loved the private pool, which was surprisingly large and perfect for relaxing anytime of the day. Overall, everything exceeded our expectations. Highly recommended!

Fantastic choice for families and anyone looking for a luxurious beachfront escape. The pool-access rooms (my room is 1001) are outstanding, offering direct entry to beautiful, well-maintained pools that make every morning feel like a holiday. The resort also shines in its activities for kids, with a fun, safe, and creative program that keeps children excited and engaged. They have the kids journey to achieve and receive the gift at the end Its location right on the beach is unbeatable‚Äîjust a few steps from coral sand, calm waves, and stunning sunrise views. The service is consistently warm and friendly, from check-in to housekeeping, making the entire stay feel genuinely cared for. The club lounge is another highlight, with a relaxed atmosphere, attentive staff, and great food and drinks throughout the day.

Firstly, if its not for accor plus stay benefit (itself has been nerfed) I will not consider paying for the room rate The breakfast: delicious, but underwhelming. International selections were very limited, for example the Japanese section only have MISO SOUP + another protein The hotel: definite wear and tear visible. Room aircon wasnt cold enough, the restaurant is very humid. Mosquitos are also a real issue that i find anywhere anytime, poolside, balcony, restaurant Kids club: 5 star, very friendly, very safe. The nanny service is top notch Staff: very welcoming, accomodating and helpful

We enjoyed our week stay at the Sofitel. Staff throughout the stay were extremely pleasant and attentive. The Butler service was of a high standard and all requests taken care of promptly. Thanks to them all. The Villa was well appointed and roomy with a lovely garden and swimming pool. Housekeeping did an excellent job, especially Alit, who did a super job. Breakfast and Club Millesme inclusions were lovely. We especially enjoyed The Cucina restaurant, beautiful food and staff, special thanks to Suci and Githa, who made our dining experience special.

During our stay, we enjoyed the Summer BBQ at the beachfront restaurant. The food was excellent, with a great selection of seafood, meats, sides, and desserts. We would especially like to thank Yulyastika for making our evening truly memorable. He went above and beyond, paying attention to every detail - ensuring our glasses were always full, providing fresh plates for the buffet, bringing lemon water and towels for the seafood, and promptly clearing plates so everything felt effortless and enjoyable. His attentive, thoughtful service truly elevated our dining experience.

A truly memorable stay from start to finish at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort. As Platinum members, we felt warmly recognized and valued throughout our entire visit. Upon arrival, we were personally escorted to Club Mill√©sime for a dedicated check-in. Our luggage was handled with the utmost care‚Äîthe concierge brought everything directly to our room. We were upgraded from a Luxury Room with Resort View to a Luxury Room with Pool Access. They also kindly fulfilled my request for a complimentary birthday cake for my partner, along with welcome amenities and decorations. Breakfast was great, with a peaceful spread at Club Mill√©sime and a more extensive buffet at Kwee Zeen. What really stood out was the staff, every interaction, from the front desk to dining, was warm, professional, and made us feel truly valued.

We stayed at the Sofitel for a week, with 4 others and the ability of the hotel and staff, to ensure that our trip together was exactly what we wanted during our time within the resort. The food was amazing, diverse and always very fresh. The morning buffet, was my favourite and the variety for different cuisines around the world, put it over the top. I tip my hat off to the amazing customer event team under Dian who helped me put together a surprise night for me wife after dinner one night. I can not go past the amazing effort and time that one of the staffers, Asih, put into cleaning and tidying the room! We always came back to the room being spotless, fresh towels, sheets and toiletries when needed. She even went above and beyond in folding any clothes that were dry and left outside on the clothes horse. Thank you to all at the Sofitel, our first week ever in bali and definitely a memorable one.

We had the best experience dining here! Our server, Yudi, was absolutely incredible. We came in as a big group of eight with three kids and plenty of special requests, but nothing was ever too much trouble for him. He was patient, attentive, and unbelievably quick, always appearing right when we needed something. The food was fantastic, but Yudi truly made the night memorable. Exceptional service like his is rare these days. He definitely deserves a raise! Highly recommend this place and will absolutely be back.

My husband and I had the most relaxing and enjoyable stay here - definitely one of our best holidays ever. The hospitality was exceptional from start to finish. Huge thanks to our amazing butlers Yuli, Edi, Darwin, Hendrik, and attendant Lanang for going above and beyond every day. Also grateful to Novi from the fitness centre, who kindly stayed back to help me set up the cardio room, and to Sinta, Adiana, Yulyastika and many more staff for their warm and attentive service. Sorry we didn‚Äôt catch all their names. We loved our pool villa, the beautiful Club Mill√©sime, and the great restaurants throughout the resort. Everything was immaculate, relaxing, and thoughtfully done. Highly recommend - we‚Äôre already planning our return!

Property is nice, with large pools and plenty of loungers. Food is generally good, with the exception of the kids menu, so we ended up sharing with our daughter from the a la carte, not a big deal. We stayed in off-season, so it was not particularly busy, which made the failures in service all the more disappointing. To name a few: we were made to wait for a very long time in the ‚Äúwelcome area‚Äù before we could even approach the check-in counters, only to be told our rooms weren‚Äôt ready. Although it was already past the check in time, we agreed to wait (what choice did we have?), and asked if it was possible to get rooms on a high floor to avoid having upstairs neighbors. The hotel was not busy at all, so we thought this was a simple request. However, this required another 20 minutes of ‚Äúchecking‚Äù, and yielded no clear answer. Instead, we were offered lunch. This seemed nice until we got to the nearly empty restaurant, where it took at least 30 minutes for the servers to put in our food order, and another hour for it to arrive. Again, empty restaurant, plenty of staff, just extreme disorganisation. The room saga continued afterwards - won‚Äôt bore you with details, but management ended up involved for an issue that should have easily been sorted by staff. Unfortunately, our first day experience was representative of the service during our whole stay. The staff smile a lot, but seem very poorly trained and unable to answer basic questions. Every issue is chalked up to ‚Äúmiscommunication‚Äù, even if it is clear that the issue is on their end. Management seems aware and uninterested in addressing this. It was an ok experience overall, but not one we‚Äôre in a hurry to repeat.

I had an unforgettable stay at Sofitel Nusa Dua, and I truly want to highlight how amazing the team was throughout my visit. From the moment I arrived, Jati at the Front Desk welcomed me with genuine warmth. He was incredibly polite, attentive to every detail, and always greeted me with a smile. His service really set the tone for my entire stay. Before my arrival, Najla from the Concierge team had already reached out to help organize my visit. When I mentioned that this trip was for my early birthday, she coordinated everything so beautifully‚Äîincluding arranging a surprise birthday cake in my room. She even upgraded my room to the next level, which made the experience even more special. Her professionalism and personal touch truly elevated my stay. A big appreciation also goes to Oka from Guest Experience, along with the wonderful lady who personally delivered my birthday cake. They went above and beyond by arranging my birthday cake voucher even though I booked it just one day before (it normally requires at least two days‚Äô notice). Their dedication and effort made me feel genuinely celebrated. Overall, the service, hospitality, and attention to detail were exceptional. Thank you to the whole Sofitel Nusa Dua team for making this stay one to remember. I will definitely return!

I do not understand the good reviews. Yes, service is superficially good mostly. But, beyond that, meh. Though the club staff seems to be a tad more accommodating and superb. Welcome amenities are just a basket of fruits. Asked for late check out and really bad with the response. Also, rooms are aging. Rusty rails. We walked along the beach and can see other hotels‚Äô pools seem better and cleaner. Nusa Dua is far away from a lot of places, so be sure to get a driver or a car.

I recently stayed at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort, and overall it was a wonderful and relaxing experience. The property is huge, beautifully designed, and has a premium feel from the moment you arrive. üëç Good Points ‚Ä¢ Great stay overall The resort has a peaceful, luxurious ambience and offers plenty of space to unwind. The lush landscaping and elegant interior design add to the experience. ‚Ä¢ Rooms are big and spacious The rooms are very comfortable, well-designed, and generously sized ‚Äî perfect for a relaxing holiday. The bathrooms are also large and premium. ‚Ä¢ Massive pool with a great pool bar The pool area is one of the highlights. It‚Äôs huge, beautifully maintained, and offers plenty of seating. The pool bar is excellent, with good drinks and a fun atmosphere ‚Äî especially enjoyable in the evening. ‚Ä¢ Direct access to the beach The convenience of walking straight from the resort to the beach is fantastic. The beachfront area is clean, scenic, and perfect for sunrise walks. ‚∏ª üëé Things That Could Improve ‚Ä¢ Breakfast area feels messy and overcrowded The breakfast buffet has a great variety, but the crowd management needs improvement. There were too many people at the same time, making the experience feel chaotic. ‚Ä¢ Item positioning can be improved Some food stations are placed awkwardly, causing crowd buildup. A better layout and flow would make breakfast much smoother. ‚Ä¢ Possibly due to the resort being very large It seems the high number of guests contributes to the breakfast rush and overall morning chaos. ‚∏ª Overall A lovely resort with spacious rooms, incredible pools, and direct beach access. The stay was very enjoyable, but the breakfast experience could be improved with better organization and flow. Still, a great place to relax in Nusa Dua ‚Äî and I would happily return!

This hotel is absolutely stunning from inside to outside. The rooms are nice and spacious and very clean. The staff from reception to all good and beverage are amazing, extremely friendly and happy. The food at the restaurants was incredible and had a large selection. Can not fault any aspect of the hotel and we look forward to coming back and staying again in the future.

My partner and I stayed here a few weeks ago and were absolutely blown away. Everything was perfect‚Äîfrom the beautiful, spacious room to the incredibly friendly and attentive staff. The food was amazing, and we loved spending time at the beach, the pool bar, and the spa & gym. Club Mill√©sime was a standout highlight, offering exceptional service and a private lounge that made our stay feel even more special. Truly an unforgettable experience‚Äîhighly recommended!

Our recent stay at Sofitel Nusa Dua was nothing short of sublime. The resort combines elegant design, immaculate grounds, and thoughtful amenities to create a calm, luxurious atmosphere that perfectly suits a family getaway. Every corner of the property felt carefully maintained, and the attention to detail in the room upkeep made coming back each day a genuine pleasure. Service across the resort was consistently warm, professional, and unobtrusive. Meals were beautifully presented and delicious; the resort‚Äôs restaurants ‚Äî including Toya and Kwee Zeen ‚Äî offer varied, high-quality dining experiences. We didn‚Äôt get a chance to try Cucina on this trip - another option for guests for a varied dining experience. Room service was excellent, prompt, and presented with care. The spa experience at SoSpa delivered expert, restorative treatments in a serene setting that left us relaxed and refreshed. The resort‚Äôs family facilities are outstanding: the daycare team were warm and professional, the staff across children‚Äôs programs were engaging, and the children‚Äôs activities were imaginative and well run. The gym facilities boast adequate training equipment, complete with sauna and steam rooms. Special acknowledgment With particular gratitude to three outstanding team members whose service made our visit memorable: ‚Ä¢ Gede Ame ‚Äî exemplary daily room care and service, delivered with professionalism and warmth. ‚Ä¢ Yulyastika ‚Äî attentive and gracious server at Toya, elevating our dining experience with impeccable timing and genuine hospitality. ‚Ä¢ Maya ‚Äî exceptional therapist at SoSpa, whose skill and calming presence made the treatment deeply restorative.

I truly love the Sofitel brand, and my recent stay at Sofitel Bali was especially exceptional. Everyone was so kind, and I was deeply impressed by the hotel facilities, the beach, the kids club, and the food. In particular, having a Korean-speaking butler, Robert, made communication effortless. Thanks to him, I now feel confident that even my parents‚Äîwho are not comfortable with English‚Äîcould stay at Sofitel on their own without any issues. I would also like to express my sincere gratitude to Hendrik for taking such good care of us throughout our stay. If we visit Bali again, Sofitel Nusa Dua will definitely be our choice once more. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Our recent stay at the Sofitel was exceptional! The faultless customer service by all personnel made us feel special and welcomed guests. From the initial email as they expected us right till the final correspondence after we'd returned home, the information was clear and each query responded to promptly. We make special mention of Najla, Timothy and Widya, for providing such reassurance. What a lovely surprise to be greeted with a birthday welcome when we checked into our room. The hospitality shown by the staff, especially at the Kwee Zeen Restaurant, ensured each of dining experiences over the week was memorable. Sincere compliments to the chefs for delicious meals prepared with a French flare incorporating Balinese flavours. We especially appreciated the attentiveness of 2 young servers, Sinta and Miko. They anticipated and met our every need with a smile, including at busy times. It wasn't surprising when Sinta was promoted to a higher role on an evening when a regular staff member was absent. Wishing her good luck as she progresses in her studies. Thank you Sofitel for our week of relaxation in luxury.

Our stay at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort was absolutely amazing! Everything was perfect ‚Äì from the spotless rooms and cozy beds to the outstanding service from the staff. The pools are stunning, the private beach is calm and beautifully maintained, and the breakfast buffet is one of the best we‚Äôve ever had, with a huge selection of international dishes. The tropical gardens and peaceful atmosphere make it the perfect place to relax and unwind. Highly recommended for anyone looking for true luxury in Bali! üå¥‚ú®

We had an awesome family stay at Sofitel Nusa Dua Bali. The resort is beautiful, the pools are perfect for the kids, and everything is really well looked after. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you can actually switch off and enjoy some proper family time. Huge shoutout to Diah and Bagus who took such great care of us. They were incredibly friendly, always made the kids feel special, and genuinely went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Their service really made our stay unforgettable. Highly recommend Sofitel Nusa Dua for families‚Äîcouldn‚Äôt have asked for a better holiday. We‚Äôll definitely be back!

Great service, ambiance and atmosphere. The room quality is nice, and the whole resort and the close access to the beach is a very big plus. Food items are very good, and an extra shout out to our waiter, Hendra for providing a quality service. Thank you!!

The check in process was quite slow, with lots of people waiting in comfortable chairs. Suana, our bell man, made us feel very welcome and safe when he took us to our room. We were advised at check out to take a seat also but, with no bill to pay because we paid as we went, I was not about to take a seat and wait just to say goodbye. Otherwise the crew at the resort were absolutely fabulous. The room was comfortable and spacious, but I'd think the bed may be due for replacement mattress. We had a fabulous time though and would recommend a break at this resort.

We stayed in 3 hotels and a villa during our visit to Bali, Sofitel was THE BEST! they made our honeymoon extra special the service was excellent specially Liah she made our honeymoon and my birthday set up which was so nice. Food options were okay for a few nights stay and room dining was good. We had the BBQ Night buffet options were kinda limited but it was great ambience with live entertainment. The hotel has its own beach and there are water activities nearby so you'll love it if you're into water activities. The most important is we didn't even spot an ant or any insect in our room unlike other hotels in Bali which is a big perk. The only thing is the location far from Ubud and Seminyak otherwise it would be my go to hotel for my full stay in Bali next time but we'll definitely go back for a few nights if we're back in Bali. Best hospitality.

Loved the excellent service and Rivaldo our room attendant was just wonderful. The breakfast was generous and had lots of variety. The staff were friendly and attentive. I booked with incisions and my feedback would be that whilst you are given cocktail vouchers they can only be used at Toya which can be closed due the weather. In addition, you can only use the dinner voucher at two places of which Toya is one and again if it‚Äôs closed you have 1 option. The only other option is Kwizeen and they have a very limited range of vegetarian options. I enjoyed using the gym but I‚Äôm not giving the full 5 stars on the basis of my feedback.

If you want to be treated like royalty, look no further than the Sofitel Bali. From the moment I arrived, the level of service was unparalleled‚Äîit‚Äôs clear they pride themselves on excellence. The blend of French luxury and Balinese warmth makes for a truly unique atmosphere. I enjoyed every single minute of my stay; it wasn't just a vacation, it was a world-class experience. If you‚Äôre looking for the best time in Bali, this is the right place.

To be honest eventhough the hotel is a five stars hotel unfortunately the service is like 3 stars hotel. Unlike any other five stars hotels in Bali such as kempinski, the ritz carlton hotel, the hyatt regency or andaz when you can find the real luxury experiences with the same price as sofitel At sofitel, the swimming pools alot of them are green in color like mud due to poor maintenance. And every single activities such as bike, kids club you need to pay extra. Breakfast options are just so poor. In kids club there are actually more than 8 staff incharged but still you cannot leave your kids at kids club unless you pay for extra service. So I ended up accompanying the kids and listed the staffs at the kids club gossiping because they have nothing to do! As an accor member myself own a gold member and my husband is a platinum member you will not gonna receive any upgrade! Instead eventhough in your benefit it mentions you will get the best available room, they give you a room facing the parking lot! So if you are expecting a luxury service, think many times to go to sofitel. I guarantee other luxury brand will give you better service! In here is like you are flying with budget airlines where you need to pay extra for anything.

My friend and I stayed at this hotel, and honestly, it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. This place is beautiful, and the people are so lovely! The rooms are spacious and modern, and we had an amazing resort view. Amenities were amazing, service was 10/10, and everything was clean and kept tidy. If you want to stay somewhere in Bali, book here!! You will not regret it!

Our stay at the Sofitel Hotel in Nusa Dua was absolutely amazing from start to finish. The staff were incredibly accommodating and genuinely friendly, always going above and beyond to make us feel welcome and cared for. The facilities were exceptional, from the beautiful pool area to the club lounge, everything exceeded our expectations. The dining experiences were just as impressive, with every restaurant offering delicious, beautifully presented food. A special mention goes to Kwee Zen and the wonderful staff member Ria, who made our meals even more memorable. She was so attentive, warm, and always ready with fantastic food recommendations, truly a standout part of our stay.

Exceptional Experience at Sofitel Bali I recently had the pleasure of staying at Sofitel Bali, and I must say, it was truly unforgettable. Rai, who oversees the Club Lounge and Butler team, deserves special mention for delivering outstanding service that exceeded my expectations. From the moment I arrived, the hospitality was warm and welcoming. The room was immaculately clean, with a stunning view that was simply breathtaking. The amenities were top-notch, and the food served in the lounge was delicious and expertly prepared. Rai's team went above and beyond to ensure my stay was seamless and enjoyable. Their attention to detail, proactive approach, and warm smiles made me feel like royalty. I would highly recommend Sofitel Bali to anyone looking for a luxurious and memorable experience. Special thanks to Rai and the entire team for making my stay so special We will come back!

Good points - well maintained and overall stunning facade and facilities Downers This is our 3rd sofitel this year. The other 2 being siem reap and Phnom Penh. Sofitel Bali lacks a certain personal touch the other 2 (esp siem reap) managed to achieve. The stuff smile at you, but you get the feeling it is all just a show. At siem reap and Phnom Penh, on check in we were personally greeted by their general manager. By day 2, we were being addressed by name even by stuff who we have not interacted with before. Siem reap stuff genuinely seem like they want to serve you, we accidentally brought some sand into your room once and within 1min of calling the front desk, 2 attendants were at our doorstep and they really couldn't wait to help us clean. When we checked out and boarded the taxi to the airport, the entire team lined up at the foyer to wave us good bye. Granted sofitel Bali is simply a much larger establishment. Perhaps with so many guests, no one is truly special. In siem reap, we always felt welcomed in the club lounge. We felt like it is a place to enter, have a sit on a sofa, grab a cold drink and be in absolute peace. Bali club lounge always felt crowded. There's always someone rushing forward to grab the food. High tea was a nice touch but the lounge is fully packed. Felt like you are in a crowded restaurant more than a 5star lounge. Cocktail hours are even more packed. Plus there is a policy for no kids during cocktail hours. We are a family for 2 with our 1year old. We were told we can leave him at the kids club, but how could you expect a parent to leave their 1year old behind. The workaround then is to have 1 parent enter the lounge a few mins before closure to order the drinks and take the food, only for the other parent to bring the kid in the minute cocktail hour ends. But our kid gets tired by the time cocktail hour ended. So we never truly got to enjoy it. I have been to other hotels with a similar no kid policy, but their workaround was to have a separate sitting area for families and it worked out really well. As stated above, lounge was packed all the time, thus I'm assuming many people are ALL platinum. Perhaps that was why we were also basically not given a room upgrade. In the other 2 sofitels, we were upgraded to the junior suite for free. I'll likely be giving the sofitel brand name another chance at Hanoi next year, if they disappoint too it might be time to jump away from Accor

Went here for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it! We had dinner at Cucina and the food was amazing. Breakfast at Kwee Zeen was also great with plenty of options. We really enjoyed the pools, the private beach access, and how clean and well-maintained everything was. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The location is perfect too (just a short walk to Bali Collection). We had such a wonderful stay and can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Robert truly made our honeymoon stay at Sofitel unforgettable. He speaks Korean fluently and consistently provided warm, thoughtful, and professional assistance throughout our stay. No matter the situation, he was always kind, attentive, and ready to help. Thanks to Robert, our honeymoon felt incredibly comfortable, stress-free, and full of happy moments. We would like to express our sincere thanks to Robert for making our honeymoon so special. We were sorry that we couldn‚Äôt meet him at check-out, but we hope to see him again when we return to Sofitel for another vacation after working hard and saving up.

We recently stayed at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort, and I honestly can‚Äôt express enough how beautiful and kind the staff were throughout our entire stay. We felt so blessed from the moment we arrived. The food, service, pool, and drinks were all absolutely amazing ‚Äî everything exceeded our expectations. A very special mention to our butler, Diah, who truly made our stay incredible. Every morning, she came to see us at breakfast to make sure we had everything we needed for the day and that all our bookings were taken care of. Her warm personality and exceptional service made us feel so well looked after. We highly recommend Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua to anyone looking for a luxurious and unforgettable getaway. We can‚Äôt wait to come back!

This resort is magnificent. The view is so stunning, and the overall property is truly five-star. Unluckily that I'm only here to attend the meeting, so I didn't get to fully enjoy the pools or the beautiful beach. The meeting facilities and business service were excellent, but the setting makes you instantly want to switch to vacation mode! Next time, I will definitely spend time for this hotel for a proper holiday. Highly recommended for both business and leisure!

Stayed at the Sofitel Nusa Dua Garden Villa for 2 nights. The room was maintained to an exceptionally high standard and we were very well looked after by our butler Robert. Robert was very attentive, very good at helping us make dinner reservations, would schedule when housekeeping would come to our villa and continued to look after us even after check out whilst we stayed at the villa for the morning. Would highly recommend staying at the Sofitel.

Every single staff member went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable. The concierge was incredible ‚Äî they handled all our activity and dinning bookings effortlessly over WhatsApp, which made everything so convenient. The wait staff were extremely attentive, and to my surprise, they even left a complimentary birthday cake in our room upon check-in because it happened to be my birthday that day ‚Äî such a thoughtful touch! We also booked a ‚ÄúRomantic Beach Dinner‚Äù for my partner and me, and the team absolutely exceeded expectations. They had fresh flowers everywhere, even printed and framed one of our photos to display on the table, and the whole setup was stunning. It honestly felt like something out of a movie ‚Äî they even managed to flatter us both at the same time, haha! Truly an incredible experience ‚Äî highly recommend this hotel for anyone who values amazing service and attention to detail and at an incredible price point. üå∏

I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience in Sofitel. This has to be one of the best accommodations I've stayed in within Bali. From the moment I arrived, the service had been impeccable. The staff are all friendly and they really look after you. My partner was unwell just before we arrived, and we were able to get a nurse to see him in our room. The rooms are clean, and they also provided a lot of complimentary amenities. They have so many different restaurant options, bar options and even their own private beach. We did not even need to leave the resort during our stay because they had everything. I also want to give a special shoutout to Gede Ame for going above and beyond. He was so nice, did a great job with our room clean, gave us many other recommendations in Bali during our vacation. Our overall experience here has been so fantastic, I will definitely be coming back.

We had a wonderful holiday at Sofitel in mid-December, and the restaurant service was unexpectedly five-star. Breakfast was always a delight, and we were particularly impressed by Mega, the waitress, who always had a bright, sunny smile and provided highly professional service. We will definitely come back again!

We had a truly memorable stay at Sofitel Bali. The staff are well-trained, attentive, and genuinely friendly. Special thanks to Lestari at the Club Lounge check-in for her warm hospitality, Karsana who took great care of us during the Chic Picnic Dinner for our 3rd anniversary, and Tri, the Club Lounge Manager, whom we met during the All Reunion Week. We mentioned to Tri that we got engaged here at the hotel, and the next day we were surprised with a beautifully decorated room complete with a cake and thoughtful touches. It made our stay even more special! Thank you again, Tri, and the Sofitel Bali team for such an unforgettable experience. We will definitely return next year to celebrate our 4th anniversary!

Our family has just returned from the most incredible stay at the Sofitel Nusa Dua. The lobby is breathtaking; we were greeted with the warmest welcome. The resort itself is a tropical dream. The sprawling lagoon-style pools are magnificent, and our child spent countless happy hours splashing and swimming. The grounds are immaculately manicured, and the direct access to the pristine Nusa Dua beach. Our room was spacious, beautifully decorated, and offered a private plunge pool. The housekeeping staff did a phenomenal job, ensuring our space was always pristine. The dining experience at Cucina Restaurant was outstanding. What truly sets the Sofitel Nusa Dua apart, however, is its incredible staff. Every single team member we encountered greeted us with a genuine smile and went above and beyond to make our stay special. We cannot recommend the Sofitel Nusa Dua highly enough for any family seeking a luxurious, relaxing, and truly memorable getaway. Thank you for giving our family the most wonderful holiday!

Very happy with the hotel, stayed 3 full weeks there in a lagoon pool access room. The lounge is good, very friendly staff, rooms are modern and clean and the restaurants are also good. Almost every day there is a theme-evening or buffet at obe of the restaurants. Its a family resort but as solo traveller I can say its very good too. Lots of space, nice beach. I wil travel there again, its a better quality than the M√∂venpick Jimbaran and much quiter in the night as there is not a busy street full of scooters üòÑ.

Rooms were cleaned well. Some had a mold smell but the staff can accommodate you if you get a room like that. Some room balconies are located not towards the beach but still nice. The beds are huge and so comfortable. The bathroom area is spacious and comfortable as well. There is so much food and luxury at Sofitel there isn't much to complain about. The staff and their professional and accompanying service is A+. I APPRECIATED THEM! We were a large group celebrating my friends 50th birthday. The Sunday brunch is a MUST if you love food like me! The staff again excellent and so down to earth. The pool area was always clean. The beach is terrible. That is my only complaint since I love to be in beach water. The temple experience and cultural heritage center was super cool to experience. We learned a lot. Cover up if you go. And hide any items that can be snatched up from the monkeys. The Koral restaurant is amazing to dine. The spas are also very friendly and relaxing to try out. THE INFAMOUS SWING!! DO IT!! Its breathtaking! Otherwise, the hotel could use more adult nightly entertainment as well but you will keep busy during the day anyway. I love this resort and would definitely recommend it. Its top tier balling at every level. The McDonald's even delivered to the resort one night. That was so cool! Looking forward to returning one day. VISIT BALI

My wife and I stayed for our wedding anniversary - we were treated like Royalty - I have never stayed somewhere so welcoming and hospitable - the staff were extremely friendly and attentive, all of them even just in passing. The food was next level great, my wife I didn't want to leave the resort. The prices were reasonable what the quality. This resort had everything, every activity, a spa, great gym, beach area. The only downside if any was the amount of people smoking, people would smoke in the pool, outside breakfast, on the pathway you couldn't escape it and it was a real downside. Maybe a dedicated smoking area away from the rooms / pools and staff enforcement would make it better. With that said we will easily return to the Sofitel Nusa Dua Bali.

This resort is a private paradise in itself. The grounds leading up to the resort is well maintained including the property. The decor and rooms are eloquently designed. The resort is spacious and impressive. The room, bathroom and balcony are spacious. The pool area was amazing. And the beach was also nice. It comes with all that you need. The food was great. And overall the staff were very polite, attentive and friendly.

Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort: A Delightful Family Haven with Tropical Charm Fresh off a memorable week at the Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort, I'm happy to report it delivered a fantastic family escape‚Äîespecially for parents with a young explorer like our energetic 6-year-old. Perched directly on Nusa Dua's powdery white sands, the resort blends sophisticated French flair with authentic Balinese serenity, from its verdant gardens to the gentle sea breezes. It's an ideal spot for creating carefree memories without venturing far, and we'd happily go back for more. The rooms stood out as a true comfort zone. We opted for a family suite that's generously sized and cleverly laid out, featuring a plush king bed for the adults and a cozy nook with a pull-out bed perfect for our little one. High-thread-count linens, a deep soaking tub, and those luxurious Molton Brown bath products made it feel like a treat every time we stepped inside. The private balcony, with its garden views, was our go-to for bedtime stories under the stars‚Äîpure magic for a 6-year-old's imagination. Cleanliness, however, left a bit to be desired in spots. The common areas were spotless and inviting, but our room showed some wear: a smudge here, a forgotten towel there, and once, a stray leaf from the gardens that housekeeping overlooked. It's minor in the grand scheme, but for a luxury resort, we expected that flawless finish. The team was quick to respond with a friendly refresh, turning it into a non-issue. On the brighter side, the food was an absolute triumph. The on-site dining options spoiled us with variety and quality‚Äîthink vibrant buffets at Kwee Zeen by the beach, loaded with fresh Balinese satays, grilled seafood, and kid-friendly gems like buttery noodles and fruit skewers. Our 6-year-old devoured the build-your-own pancake bar at breakfast, stacking on chocolate chips and bananas with glee, while we savored the elevated flavors of the Italian trattoria Bene, where handmade pastas and gelato stole the show. It was flavorful, fresh, and fuss-free‚Äîideal for keeping everyone happy. What really sealed the deal for us was the kid-centric fun. The Little Sofitel Kids' Club was a godsend for our 6-year-old, offering age-appropriate adventures like making colorful Balinese masks, simple cooking classes (hello, mini fruit salads!), and scavenger hunts that had him scampering through the grounds like Indiana Jones. The staff's warm, attentive energy made drop-offs easy and pick-ups full of excited recaps. And the pools? A watery wonderland. The main lagoon pool cascades into shallower, gentler sections just right for a 6-year-old to splash and float safely, complete with a fun slide and colorful inflatables. We lounged on the family-friendly edges while he built sandcastles nearby‚Äîbliss for parents and pure joy for kids. All in all, this resort is well worth a visit for families craving that sweet spot of luxury and playfulness. The exceptional rooms, mouthwatering meals, and tailored activities for little ones eclipse the housekeeping quirks. Book it for your next Bali jaunt‚Äîyou won't regret it. Rating: 4.5/5 stars.

Overall we enjoyed our stay and due to my Accor + Explorer memberships we were provided a room upgrade to a Pool access room , which was fantastic. We were disappointed on the food and cocktail selections from the Pool Bar and the food from the Toya Bar on the beach front. We were invited to an Accor member drinks one evening and spoke with the Food and Beverage Manager (2 In Charge) and provided our feedback on our recent stay in the Padma resort in Legian. The food and drinks selection at the Padma was great with many options. We provided one example from the Sofitel Pool bar of the Calamari Balls, which we had one day and they were like hard dry breadcrumb balls. We suggested that the Sofitel review their menus and add better snack selections, like Chicken wings, Satay sticks, Hamburger sliders and better hand made chips etc. We had dinner one night at the Toya bar, with Fish and Ribs. The ribs were tender but lacked flavour. Please review these menus and have senior staff or guests try out new menus to improve customers experience. Another item was Shade around the main pool. There is generally only one row of umbrellas on the 2nd row of sun lounges. The first row is in the water, have no umbrellas and hardly anyone uses them, as it is too hot to stay in the sun for too long. More umbrellas need to be added, so more guests can have shade on the lounges. We are returning in March April 2026 and hope to see the Sofitel address ours and likely other customers feedback.

Sofitel Nusa Dua is a beautiful experience - from the moment we arrived - the upgrade,the special touches during our stay until the moment we left. The place is big and you never felt like the resort was crowded - the buffet breakfast is pretty amazing with so much to choose from and set up like little deli's. The beachfront is stunning, restaurants, massage and water sports all handy. I don't think you could can go wrong with a stay at Sofitel

After 30 years from our last visit to this once far away resort location we returned for a quick 3 night break before heading to Seminyak. What a welcoming surprise we arrived at the Sofitel and from the moment we arrived it was like we were family, the staff are amazing, the facilities are next level and the pool is so big and so clean, we had no reason to leave the resort over the 3 days and they catered to our every need. The restaurants were amazing and special mention to the lovely waitress Suci in the Italian restaurant Cuccina.

Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua made a strong impression from the start. I loved the welcome gift of the Sofitel-logo bracelet for the whole family. As a Platinum member, I was upgraded to a pool access room and checked in at the club lounge with a Coco Pandan drink, snacks and cold towels. The room had a fruit basket and cake for our occasion, and the extra bed was already set up as requested. The resort looks fresh and modern on the outside. Service across our three nights was consistently good. Ami from Cucina stood out for being friendly and making sure we had a good dinner. She might be new, but she handled everything well. Breakfast at Kwee Zeen had good variety, and having squirrels running around in the outdoor area kept the kids entertained. The kids club was well equipped and both children enjoyed it. The gym staff were friendly and helpful, which made using the gym a pleasant part of the stay. The club lounge was comfortable for work and quiet time, though cocktail hour felt a bit off because shorts and slippers were accepted. It took away from the lounge atmosphere. The pools were a big part of the stay. Direct pool access from the room was the highlight and made it easy for the family to jump in anytime. The only downside was the kids pool. It looked more aged than the others, with popped tiles, some algae and non-working fountain spouts. Overall, Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua delivered a comfortable family stay, and the pool access room made the trip. I‚Äôd return, but I hope the kids pool and lounge dress expectations get tightened up.

We recently stayed at the Sofitel Nusa Dua for 6 nights . We stayed in a pool access room that was absolutely beautiful and well appointed & clean . The staff were all excellent and nothing was ever a problem . We had access to the mileseme club and attended the happy 2 hours nightly which offered a wide range of delicious snacks and free flow drinks as well as excellent attentive service . Checkin and check out in the lounge was seamless and the lounge offered a lovely environment that you could relax at anytime . The restaurants within the hotel were fantastic. The food and atmosphere were excellent as was the service. We dined at Toya on the beach and had drinks there a few times. The food , drinks and service were excellent as was the atmosphere. The few nights they had a solo artist he was excellent . The Italian restaurant was also excellent with great service and delicious food . The buffet breakfast was fantastic and offered a huge range of choices that suit everyone and bonus it had great coffee that you could order and have delivered to your table . Whenever we needed a taxi the concierge arranged it for us without a hitch . I highly recommend this hotel if you are wanted a chilled relaxing atmosphere without the hustle and bustle .

Holiday to remember We would like to thank the amazing staff at Sofitel Nusa Dua Beach Resort for making our 7 night stay a real pleasure. A special thank you to; Della, at Cucina Restaurant, for being such a friendly and attentive waitress. Pilot, for his creative and surprising daily towel animals and meticulous cleaning of our Villa every day. Yuli, from Club Millesime Service, for always taking the time to welcome us. Finally, we wish to acknowledge the Butler team - Rai, Robert, Edi, Yuli and Darwin, who distinguished themselves by creating a memorable birthday celebration, for Teresa, which was the highlight of our holiday. It is the kindness and dedication of these people, which draws us back to this Hotel. David and Teresa

I spent 5 nights here to relax at the end of my Bali trip. It was very peaceful despite being close to capacity. My room was very spacious, modern and clean. The large bed was possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! My room was ready on arrival. Asih did a fabulous and thorough job as my room attendant. I didn‚Äôt use the pool as I preferred to use the lounges on the beach and swim in the ocean. The beach was kept very clean during my stay. All of the resort grounds were very well maintained. The breakfast buffet had a great range but I was a bit disappointed that the majority of it was uncovered and open. A lot of guests appeared sick and were coughing everywhere so I chose to only eat freshly cooked food or things that had just been freshly replenished. I gratefully received a very generous late checkout time, but when my night flight was delayed until the following morning, the charge to stay on for the rest of the night was ridiculously expensive - apparently due to high occupancy. I had to move to a different hotel. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would stay there again if I was able to book with a similar promotional/price.

Another memorable stay at this beautiful hotel. Food is always delicious and the staff both in the restaurants and facilities is amazing. Special mention to Pande, manager of pool area. Suffering from a knee injury during my stay was a little challenging, but thanks to the consistent care and attention given to us by Pande and his staff, made our stay so much easier. Special mention to Tia, Sinta at Kwee Zeen for their excellent service as well as Mega whom we have known for a number of years and has always been an absolute pleasure to deal with. We are sure to return again.

Excellent customer service, attended to our every request quickly and with a smile. The only thing I would like to suggest is to make the place a bit bright and festive. The feel of the hotel was a bit gloomy and sad. Good thing the staff were the opposite - always happy and excited to greet us!

Concierge was great in recommending our itinerary for food and making some bookings. Service was top notch from all employees. Pool and beach was great. This could be architectural or a limitation to Bali, or global warming, airflow was almost stagnant throughout the hotel. Except for good aircon in room and reception, we were sweating out of these areas. We expected aircon or some good airflow in the hotel's restaurants at the very least, however was eating in sweat with fans blowing hot air. If Bali's temperature is going to get worse, hotels need to rethink their airflow strategy. Breakfast buffet was average. Japanese and Chinese corner can be 100x better. Dim sum didn't look appetising and teriyaki beef was very dry. Western and Indonesian corner was good. The fresh wok fried noodles was a good touch, however, hit and miss on its seasoning over our 3x breakfast there.

Hotel overall was fine, not quiet as we expected in the respect of: rooms are dated, worn and in need of a refresh, bathroom (mostly the bath) and furniture mainly, but the products were very nice. Pool area, the floor around the area needs a deep clean as does the pool especially around the waterline. Cracks and missing/loose tiles had been left for sometime or poorly fixed. Lounge beds had peeling paint and lounge cushions were all marked and stained, but towels were readily available and very clean and good quality. Service from the team team around the pool is good and they were all helpful and pleasant. Staff generally are very friendly but we were constantly being asked to review and were given cards in all restaurants including breakfast multiple times, which becomes tiresome. Food was fine, nothing stand out or terrible, but there are plenty of options outside that are wider range, better quality and variety of cost. There was a large wedding taking place - which we were informed about just before our stay... which did impact the beach and pool area during the day and evening over the course of a few days - due to stage/band set up which at times was very loud, but the hotel did set up extra facilities and staff to cope with the extra guests. We enjoyed our holiday but would not stay at this resort again, there is a lot of choice in Bali and for the price range we have stayed in better.

We are currently staying at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua and honestly, this has been one of the most disappointing hotel experiences we‚Äôve ever had especially from a property that claims to be 5-star. We booked two rooms under our loyalty membership, expecting comfort and quality service. Instead, from the moment we checked in, the experience has been shocking. When we entered our room, the drawer was completely empty not even basic amenities like tea bags. We had to call just to request those. Then things got worse. When I took a shower, I found blood stains in the shower and near the sink. I tried to overlook it and clean it myself, but later, when I went to bed, I found more blood marks on the bed sheets. Absolutely unacceptable. For a 5-star hotel, this level of hygiene is beyond disgusting. We immediately contacted guest services, who said the manager would call us back within 5 minutes but no one did. After I called again, all they said was that someone would come to change the sheets. When the manager finally arrived, he crossed his arms and spoke to me in a dismissive manner, as if I was the problem. That kind of attitude is unprofessional and completely disrespectful. We are paying for 4 nights across 2 rooms, and this is what we get blood stains, poor service, and a manager who doesn‚Äôt seem to care. This place does not deserve its 5-star rating. The staff clearly need proper training in hygiene, customer service, and basic hospitality. We are writing this review while still staying here because that‚Äôs how upset and angry we are. What a disappointment from a brand we used to trust.

We were overwhelmed with the incredible hospitality and facilities at the resort. Both parents and children had a wonderful time, enjoying the aqua aerobics, kids club, incredible Club Millesime and pristine gardens. Our butler Nicky was a standout, making us feel at home and showing thoughtfulness and kindness at every step. We will be back!

I had an excellent stay at Sofitel Nusa Dua, Bali. The room was spacious, comfortable, and beautifully maintained. One of the highlights of my stay was dining at Kwee Zeen restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious with great variety and presentation. I especially want to mention Mr. WIKANTARA, who provided truly 5-star service, friendly, and always ensuring that guests had the best experience possible. Overall, it was a memorable stay with outstanding hospitality from all the staff. I would highly recommend Sofitel Nusa Dua to anyone looking for a luxurious and relaxing getaway in Bali.

Stayed with family in a poolside suite. We've been to Bali many times before, and we would rate Sofitel's beachfront and suitability for kids among the best. Suggested areas for improvement: - Very long check-in (half hour wait queuing at reception) - We found the F&B disappointing (e.g. Breakfast: disintegrated dim sum; Bali coffee that tasted burnt, like the machine was not cleaned properly; lack of queue management. And Toya Bar felt as if the food was prepared by staff who were inexperienced in western cuisine) - Among the bikes for hire, it would have been good to have bikes suitable for young kids to ride with us along the boardwalk.

My wife and I stayed here recently and genuinely what an amazing experience, the staff were exceptional and from arrival too departure we were so well looked after we were sorry to leave. This was our first trip to Bali and we will definitely be back to Bali but more so to Sofitel Nusa Dua

Dinner Experience We had a great dinner at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua Beach Resort. The service provided at Kwee Zeen restaurant was attentive and professional. The atmosphere was comfortable and pleasant. The staff ensured everything ran smoothly, making for an enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended for quality service and good food in Bali.

Our holiday at the Sofitel was very memorable, in every aspect. What stood out for us was the exceptional staff, friendly, helpful and always smiling. Mega was one of these lovely people and there were many more too. Food was always abundant and delicious. All requests were met with genuine delight to assist. We highly recommend this resort.

From the welcoming to the departure was great. Love the location, the ambiance, the pool, the service of everyone was amazing. The place was clean. The attention to detail when building this place is superb. The restaurant Cucina was amazing, food was great. Went with friends but definitely going back with my husband.

I hosted my sister‚Äôs 50th birthday celebration here, and Sofitel Nusa Dua completely exceeded my expectations. As a travel agent and group leader, I‚Äôve organized many group trips around the world ‚Äî but this experience truly stood out. Every department delivered 5-star service ‚Äî from sales, concierge, bell staff, restaurants, and housekeeping ‚Äî everyone went above and beyond. A very special thank you to Prilla from the Sales & Events team, who made everything seamless. Her professionalism, kindness, and attention to detail made our celebration unforgettable. This is the first time I‚Äôve ever received a gift as a travel agent, and it meant so much. Sofitel‚Äôs genuine hospitality and thoughtful touches set a new standard for excellence. Sofitel Nusa Dua is now my top recommendation and priority hotel for future client stays. Thank you to the entire team for making our ‚ÄúFifty & Fabulous‚Äù celebration truly exceptional! ‚Äî Kumba Janga, Travel Allure

A Honeymoon Dream Come True ‚Äì Pure Luxury at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua From the moment we arrived at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua, we knew we were in for something special‚Äîbut nothing could have prepared us for the exceptional experience that awaited us. We were celebrating our honeymoon, and the resort went above and beyond to make it unforgettable. Upon check-in, we were graciously upgraded to one of their stunning villas‚Äîan incredible surprise that set the tone for our entire stay. The villa was absolute perfection: spacious, beautifully designed, and incredibly private, with our own pool and a serene tropical ambiance that made every moment feel magical. The service throughout our stay was flawless. Every staff member we encountered greeted us warmly and made us feel genuinely valued and cared for. It‚Äôs clear that hospitality at Sofitel is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a passion. From the sweet honeymoon touches to the personalized attention during our meals, the team made every detail feel thoughtful and sincere. The resort grounds are immaculate, offering a perfect blend of elegance and tropical beauty. The restaurants served world-class cuisine, and the beachfront location gave us postcard-worthy views every single day. Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua truly delivered a five-star experience in every possible way. This wasn‚Äôt just a stay‚Äîit was a celebration of love and luxury that we will remember for the rest of our lives. We cannot thank the team enough for making our honeymoon so extraordinary. We are already dreaming of our return!

Beautiful hotel.. just stunning views, amazing food, fabulous service and the rooms are just beautiful. We had a private pool room and it was just luxurious.. standout staff member for us was Ricky who checked us in and made us feel so welcome‚Ä¶ then we were pleased to see him farewell us again on checkout‚Ä¶ lovely guy and so helpful with information

Staying at the Sofitel is supposed to be relaxing and nice. But you can see rats, mouse close to the restaurants. The food at the restaurant Kwee Zeen and Cocina has no taste. The have a pizza oven, but the pizza looks like a crusty cr√™pe with some tomate soup or ketchup... The water in the swimming pool is blurry. Even if I warm them about the color, they didn't take action. The five star is not for the food.... I was very disappointed about the stay. The club mill√©sime is very nice and the is kind and professional. Don't go to Sofitel. You pay too much for less confort and less pleasure.

Perfect Family Getaway! We had such a wonderful stay! The hotel was clean, comfortable, and had everything we needed for a relaxing vacation. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, and the location made exploring super easy. We made amazing memories and can‚Äôt wait to return! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èüíå

Concierge was really good, Nelson helped with luggage storage when we wanted to go for island tours. Stay was good with great food as well. I was expecting pristine and nice beach but it was stinky and unbearable to stay on beach.

We had an amazing stay at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua. The resort is stunning, beautifully maintained, and right on a gorgeous stretch of beach. The suite was spacious and very comfortable, and the facilities from the pool to the restaurants were outstanding. The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, always ready to help with a smile. Love the club lounge. Every detail made our holiday relaxing and memorable. Highly recommend this resort to anyone visiting Bali and we can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Nice stay with great facilities and amenities! The room was spacious and the breakfast offered varieties although taste was a bit hit and miss! Gym was well equipped, a bit smallish if compared to a similar five star hotel, but Sofitel has a separate cardio room! Overall was a great stay with a group of friends

One of the best hotels in Bali. We had a fantastic 6-day family vacation at Sofitel Nusa Dua. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a better room, which was a great start. The pools were absolutely amazing ‚Äî large, clean, and so inviting that we spent most of our time in them! The staff were friendly and attentive, and the resort overall was beautiful and peaceful. Breakfasts were delicious with plenty of variety. A perfect spot for a relaxing family getaway. We‚Äôd love to come back!

We had a truly fantastic dinner. Everything was so well done, and the staff was incredibly attentive. We were served by Marsi, who was exceptionally accommodating and attentive to our every need. The setting is absolutely beautiful. We dined under a gorgeous tree, surrounded by lush greenery and a stunning view of the beach. The atmosphere was enhanced by great live music. The food was also outstanding. We particularly enjoyed the mixed grill, which was incredibly flavorful and cooked to perfection. We can't wait to come back!

Thank you to Sofitel for making our stay memorable. We could not ask for more, it was exactly what we wanted. All staff members were absolutely wonderful and very welcoming. We will be back! Thank you to all the Balinese people.

Sofitel Nusa Dua was a sanctuary of relaxation and calm. The staff were so generous with thier assistance always with a ready smile. Our day started with breakfast at Kwee Zeen, so many choices, fabulous! Mira (Kwee Zeen), was so attentive, and professional. Really enjoyed talking with her about food, culture and local places to visit. Asih (house keeping), always welcomed us with her beautiful smile. Made sure we had everything we needed. We felt so welcomed by her. Our room was always beautiful, thank you!

Amazing Resort! üåü We had an incredible stay ‚Äî the staff were consistently friendly and helpful. A special shout-out to Nova, our room attendant, who went above and beyond to provide exceptional service throughout our week. Professional, welcoming, and attentive ‚Äî Nova truly made our stay memorable. Highly recommend!

We highly recommend this resort!! Our holiday at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua was very memorable. The staff was friendly, helpful and informative. They're warm smile was make me feel like home. My room was very spacious, modern and clean. Will back for the next holiday!

Coming from the Padma Resort we stayed three-night at the Sofitel Resort. While the resort's aesthetics are undeniably stunning, with its prime beachside location and restaurants offering picturesque ocean views, my overall experience was unfortunately affected by several concerns. Firstly, I found the pathways surrounding the pools to be uncomfortable to walk on; the black pavers felt uncomfortably hot underfoot. Furthermore, the condition of the corridors outside the rooms and stairwells was disappointing, marred by paint stains that detracted from the overall ambiance. In our room, the lounge area had a significant stain that had clearly been overlooked. Additionally, I felt that the pricing for food and drinks was excessively high for the quality provided. Specifically, the prices at the Bali Collection seemed unjustifiably similar to those in Sydney, which I found to be excessive.

Luxurious Stay with Amazing Food and Private Pool Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua is a truly luxurious resort with a perfect beachfront location. Our room had a private plunge pool, which was a highlight ‚Äî relaxing, private, and so enjoyable. The resort itself is big, beautifully designed, and full of tropical charm. The food was excellent with plenty of variety, especially at breakfast. Every meal was delicious, and the service throughout the stay was friendly and professional. The main pool is large and fun, and the whole atmosphere is peaceful yet vibrant.

Have had an amazing stay at this hotel! Rooms are clean and comfortable and the amenities are amazing. The staff are so welcoming and attentive, had great service at all of the restaurants especially with Rista at Kwee Zeen. Would 100% recommend anyone stay here, such a great experience!

From the moment we arrived at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua beach resort we were blown away by the impeccable facilities and professionalism of the staff. They created such a great environment for the children and in particular the butler team of Suci, Edi, Ayu & Bagus were incredible, offering 5 star service throughout our stay and are a real credit to the Sofitel. We would absolutely recommend to anyone seeking a resort holiday in Bali. We will be back next year!

Our return to Sofitel Nusa Dua after 6 years did not disappoint Room was clean and spacious and resort facilities superb It was lovely to see Sri at breakfast as we had come to know her from another resort Her hospitality and service is outstanding Quite surprised she remembered us since we have not seen her for over 7 years!! I thoroughly recommend Sofitel for it‚Äôs location, food and staff

It is the first hotel I visited twice while traveling abroad. Three years ago, before marrying my current wife, I had such good memories that we got married and visited this hotel again. Beyond my expectations, my memory of this hotel has improved. Manager RAI's hospitality service, meticulous care, and daily support for Butler Eddie and DIAH to enjoy the hotel. I hope I can visit again this hotel again with my family upcoming day.
Excellent hotel for family. Extensive facilities for family. Sami attended us for breakfast. Amazing service. She was attentive, smiling, and servicing our table for breakfast.

Totally changing my review. Initially I was frustrated by some problems with my room and the speed of service, but after speaking with management team, they really jumped into action to make things right for us. It is a beautiful resort and the staff are all eager to please. I will say that during our one week stay in mid-August that the main pool area was completely overrun by children. Even the swim up bar had kids bumping into us. It does seem to be a great place for families with young kids. If, like us, you prefer to get away from the kids, the beach is nice, but get there early as there is limited seating. Also the Manarai Beach Club adjacent to Sofitel is very nice and not as crowded. It has nice pool, swim up bar, restaurant and daybeds. Didn‚Äôt notice any kids there, but I think you have to buy a membership to use the pool. Not sure about that. Sofitel rooms are starting to show their age. I would not classify it as 5-stat, but it is a solid 4-star. Food was decent. The Sunday brunch was really good, definitely worth the price.

I recently stayed at Sofitel Nusa Dua for 4 nights in September and had a truly wonderful experience. One of the highlights was the breakfast ‚Äì the variety of choices was impressive, catering to both international and local tastes. Everything was fresh, well-prepared, and beautifully presented. A special mention to Wikan, who provided exceptional service throughout our stay. He was always attentive, friendly, and went out of his way to ensure we were comfortable and well taken care of. His genuine care and professionalism made a big difference in our experience. Thank you to the entire team at Sofitel Nusa Dua for a memorable stay ‚Äì we look forward to returning!

We stayed at the sofitel. It was very nice and the plunge pool was great. We had dinner at the Toya Beach Bar and Grill and were served by Yulyastika. He was very welcoming and the service was amazing. Thank you

We enjoyed staying here for a big fat Indian wedding. The only problem we had was that we had a cleartoilet door meaning that whoever was brushing their teeth could look into the toilet. Ideally, there would be a way to close off that space for some privacy - not a major issue, but that would have helped.

From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel welcome and cared for. The room was beautifully designed and comfortable, amazing breakfast The facilities were first-class, the ambiance was relaxing, and the service was beyond excellent. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and unforgettable experience!

I recently stayed at Sofitel Bali Nusa Dua and had a truly wonderful experience. I‚Äôd like to especially thank May and her team for professionalism and for going above and beyond to arrange a new room for my late check-out ‚Äî it made my departure so much more comfortable. Also, a big thank you to Panda for taking such great care of all my luggage with efficiency and a smile. The service throughout my stay was impeccable, and the team truly made me feel welcomed and well looked after. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Bali!

We‚Äôve spent 4 nights here at Sofitel Nusa Dua. What an impressive hotel, such attention to detail and wonderful staff. The Club Milliseme‚Äô is a luxurious touch and well worth paying the extra $. We‚Äôve thoroughly enjoyed our stay. A big shout out to some of the incredible staff- Yuli our butler, Nick- our room attendant, Billy- at the pool bar, and Wikan- at Kwee Zeen restaurant ‚ù§Ô∏è

We had a truly wonderful stay at the Sofitel Hotel in Bali, our second time here, and once again, it exceeded all expectations! From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed and felt right at home. The hotel fulfilled every request we had quickly and effortlessly, with everything handled professionally and with genuine care. What really stood out to us was the incredible staff. Everyone from reception to housekeeping to the restaurant team, was incredibly kind, open, and attentive. Every question or need was met without delay, always with a smile. The restaurant staff, in particular, made our dining experiences extra special with their warmth and friendliness. The food was amazing, and the atmosphere felt like home. We are so happy with both of our visits and are already looking forward to coming back again. Thank you to the entire Sofitel Bali team for making our stay so comfortable, relaxing, and memorable!

We had a wonderful stay at the Sofitel. The resort was lovely but the service was impeccable. Beautiful staff. We made some lovely connections and a special thank you to Sri for her kindness and service. We hope to be back soon to see you. X

VERY DISAPPOINTED This was the second time that we stayed at this hotel this year. We were 13 people, 4 families in 5 rooms, over a period of 11 days. From the first day we noticed that maintenance is neglected, particularly at the swimming pool where you can suffer small cuts in your feet due to the deteriorating condition of the floor. At the time of reservation, I asked for a late check out for 1 of the rooms. On the day of departure, we were informed that only 1 hour for late check out was approved but we can stay at the hotel for a late shower. WHAT NOBODY SAID The only available showers offered were those near the main swimming pool. These showers do not have any kind of privacy; you must shower in an open place in front of anyone with cold water (there is not hot water at all) and the drains were clogged with water up to the ankles.

We spent 4 nights here during our multi stop vacation. The staff was great and welcoming, which was the highlight of our stay. The room was nice but standard for a 5* at that price. We had a good stay but it didn't feel any special. In fact, we missed the hotel we stayed out during our previous stop on the island. The hotel is more of a resort, in a high end secluded tourist area. Don't expect any immersion in the culture there. The two points that were a big let down were: 1- The breakfast was not good. It's a bit ironic for a hotel that plays on the French touch not to be able to make a proper croissant (the other hotel was able to, so it's not due to a lack of produce). Even the local Balinese/Indonesian food was subpar compared to our previous stop at a different hotel. This matters when you are in an area where you don't really have many options around. Because of this we avoided getting any lunch or dinner and opted to walk 20 min to the neighborhood mall everyday instead. 2- Even though it's already a pricey hotel for Bali, everything felt like an add-on, for which we have to pay extra. Feel like a yoga class to start your day? There's a fee... Want to borrow one of the bicycles to go around the neighborhood? There's also a fee... Feel like enjoying the beach club which is the only place that has a pool with a view on the beach? Yeah... There's also a fee for that... Add the fact that all prices are 5 to 10x the cost at other local options and you really feel like a piggy bank walking around. If you like resort style vacation and don't mind paying for every move you make, it may be a good spot, I personally will not come back.

Disappointing Birthday Stay at Sofitel Bali ‚Äì Not What I Expected from a Luxury Property I stayed at Sofitel Bali for three nights to celebrate a landmark birthday ‚Äî a milestone I was hoping to mark with a memorable experience. Unfortunately, several serious lapses made the stay anything but enjoyable. 1. Check-in Delays: Despite a confirmed check-in time, we were made to wait nearly two hours before getting our room. After a long journey, this was incredibly frustrating. 2. Dangerous Bicycle Incident: While cycling on one of the hotel‚Äôs bicycles, the crank literally broke off mid-ride, causing a violent slip and a near-injury. I was lucky not to have fractured my leg. When I returned to the hotel with the broken crank and requested transportation for my two friends still cycling, the staff refused to help ‚Äî a shocking response to a potentially serious safety issue. 3. Unauthorized Credit Card Charge: After settling my bill at checkout, I later received a manual charge on my credit card without any communication or consent. While the amount may have been correct, charging a guest post-checkout without informing them is deeply unprofessional and frankly, borders on fraud. When I raised these concerns, the duty manager offered some loyalty points as compensation ‚Äî but that felt like an afterthought rather than a genuine attempt to make things right. For a brand that promises luxury and service excellence, this stay was sorely disappointing. I hope the management takes these issues seriously ‚Äî no guest should have to deal with safety hazards, poor service, or billing surprises, especially when celebrating a once-in-a-decade occasion.
